relationship.description: this was changed from the FK to better handle syncronization; this may be set back to be a FK in the future

entity.description: This is used to specify the details for scheduled maintenance.

relationship.title: Interval
relationship.description: This can't have a foreign key because the intervalMeterTypeId field is optional, but the productId field is not

entity.description: This is for both scheduled and unscheduled maintenance; use ProductMaint to track details for scheduled maintenance
For information related to a specific vendor and product, especially for multi-vendor stores. The ProductStoreGroup is to be used much like in ProductPrice.
Used to define payments that a vendor related to the store will accept (for multi-vendor stores)
Used to define Carrier-ShipmentMethod combinations that a vendor related to the store will accept (for multi-vendor stores)

relationship.description: No foreign key because we want to optionally be able to have a partyId without the other fields.
Note that foreign key not needed because there is an fk for OrderItem.
